content:
Alias (shared mailboxes) je v podstate iný názov alebo identifikátor vašej primárnej e-mailovej adresy a nie samostatná poštová schránka. Keď vytvoríte alias adresu, e-maily prichádzajúce na túto adresu idú do priečinka doručenej pošty primárnej e-mailovej adresy.

Ak ich chcete prijímať v samostatnom priečinku, vytvorte si filter a presmerujte tieto prichádzajúce emaily do novovytvoreného "Alias" priečinka (priečinkov).
creator: Ansamb

content:
Dobrý den, tomu rozumím ale neřeší to muj problém Exchange má možnost vytvořit sdílenou poštovní schránku které přiřadím uživatele které mohu schránku používat. Emaily které příjdou do této schránky vůbec nejdou do mé hlavní email adresy ani do aliasu.

Například jsem vytvořil sdílenou schránku Faktury@ do ní má přístup několik uživatelů. v outloku jí přídam jako sdílenou schránku viz příloha
creator: david.bikerscrown

content: S týmto nemám skúsenosť. Skúste sa inšpirovať tuná: Přidání pravidel do sdílené poštovní schránky
creator: Ansamb

content: Probabilmente hai un archivio di posta molto grande e mal organizzato (tutta la posta in poche cartelle). Per cui inevitabilmente Thunderbird rallenta.

content: The Share options are hard-coded, and it's not possible to choose 3rd-party mail apps, even if they are the system default. Use the Send to, Mail recipient, in the File Explorer context menu.
creator: sfhowes

Prova anzitutto ad eliminare gli account dalla Modalità risoluzione dei problemi -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/modalita-risoluzione-problemi-thunderbird

Se non funziona, assicurati di eliminare anche i server SMTP associati all'account [Menu > impostazioni account > Server di posta in uscita (SMTP) ]

content:
Qui si è discusso di un problema che sembra analogo al tuo -> https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1344354

In pratica è necessario eseguire Thunderbird come amministratore prima di eliminare l'account. Questo perché probabilmente l'installazione non è standard e l'utente che usi non dispone dei diritti necessari per cancellare file nella directory del profilo.

content: I changed the properties of the sent unified folder to the last option to "match all messages" and they are now listed BUT the sent messages are showing twice in the unified inbox now.
creator: oldbob2

content:
Me Again..I think I found my issue..Hope I can explain so it is understood. 1. In TB email, top menu View-make sure Unified folders is checked. 2. Then On the top unified INBOX folder I right clicked and selected Properties. 3. I made sure the "Match all Msgs" is selected and then select "choose". 4. Under the first of my four email listed I only check "INBOX" and went down the list to the 2-4 email accounts and again only checked INBOX. 5. When done with the list of the 4 emails checking only Inbox, select OK the UPDATE!

Then I went to the next Unified folder I wanted to adjust which for me was SENT and again right clicked on it and selected properties and followed steps 3-5 above again only checking in each email the SENT box in each of the 4 email accounts listed. It seems I am seeing/getting/deleting emails as I want and no duplicate emails.

For some reason doing this longer individually method worked for me. Just as a note: If I now go back to properties of the Unified INBOX (right click>properties>choose), I do see on 3 of the 4 emails all the checks I selected individually but not on the first one only has is Inbox checked. I don't know why but it's not broken so I am not touching it. Hope my detail helps others.
creator: oldbob2

creator: sfhowes

content: My suggestion is to first check to see if your online account has filtering capabilities. That would stop them at the server. Your email provider may also be able to check sender's IP address as mailbombs hurt their service too. Otherwise, Thunderbird would have to deal with them after arriving there. Thunderbird's filtering can help if you see patterns. Setting junk filters is useful as a backup.
creator: davidsk

content: First, please remember that you are using a beta, and beta releases are known to have bugs. Second, the issue may relate to the size of your mail account. My suggestion is to review the size of your profile to see if that is a factor.

content:
The archive link has installers for all languages, e.g. for US English, it is:

https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/78.14.0/mac/en-US/
creator: sfhowes

content:
horned_toad said
This is what I want from the first link Thunderbird 78.14.0.dmg I do not see it I believe all the pieces are there but I need it packaged for me.

Each of the folders are abbreviations for the language locals as you will likely want one of the English options.

en-CA/ is Canadian English en-GB/ is British English (or United Kingdom) en-US/ is English US

Click on the folder you want and then you can download the Thunderbird 78.14.0.dmg

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/installing-thunderbird-on-mac
creator: James
